reviewText: *sigh* oh, i used to love this game. In fact, i still do, but this steam version is just a joke. First of all, the intro cinematic don't even play. The resolution is 800x600 and, the worst part, the soundtrack is bugged and plays the same song on all the levels. I still have the original cd, and the game is pretty enjoyable, but they should not sell a game full of flaws such as this. If they ever fix all those issues, yeah, i would recommend it, but until then, no.

reviewText: Ian Livingstone's role playing classic is brought to life in 3D. This is a game from thge depths of a retro treasure trove. It's dark and sadistic, with many monsters, traps and obstacles making this game insanely challenging. Sometimes it's seemingly impossible but it has that trademark replay value like modern classic Dark Souls which keeps you playing again and again.

reviewText: Tomb what? Back in the late 90s I was a boss amongst my middle school for conquering this title on PSX. Mind you, the PC version has total level redesign, even funkier controls, and seems overall harder, but yeah... I'll be shooting my Infernal Device at wicked Ratmen soon enough. Seriously, Lara who? What does she raid? Lil faerie would last 5 mins in teh Dungeon lawl! (I love this game so much I could cry, been looking for the PC version over a decade with no luck, one night I see it on Steam and have to make sure I didn't overdose...)

reviewText: Despite buying it on two different systems and still being unable to finish it, I've always felt like I've got my money's worth with Deathtrap Dungeon. It's so huge and so challenging that nothing in modern games compares. I hope to one day get to the end but considering that 99%+ of gamers who play this game are beaten by it, I'm not optimistic.

reviewText:
a good old game
graphicly not the best indeed it was good for its time maybe not the premium class.
The level design is challenging still today,
the game itself is scary at some parts even im now grown up i´ve played the game first when i was 14.
The enemies are weak but very different to all the games whom came after it.
The riddles are great and challenging- the story isn´t that great.
This game is pretty hard you need a lot of tries to get through one single mission.
It has 9 very well designed levels. The controls are o.k. you can change it in the menue settings.
The graphics of this version isn´t that good i remember a resolution of 1024x for that game by its original.
I know there is a way to get a better resolution but its somewere in the options menue.
I never seen another game like that after it- its still good and not just in a nostalgic way.
The saving system is o.k. its harder because it saves the moment of health too so
you have to be more strategic when and how often you save- some savepoints
need gold.
I finished this game only once back in 2000 and try to redo it again.

the bad camera angle still here and the low polygon... yes still here.  However the game is now highly playable with no lag... but some brief returns to the desktop during change of screen.

reviewText: I got this game for next to nothing for a couple of reasons: 1) I loved the series of Fighting Fantasy" choose-your-own adventure books this game is supposedly based on. 2) I dared myself to try to enjoy a game that is REALLY showing it's age. The verdict? Ain't got enough in common except in name with the former and what the hell was I thinking with the latter? This game came out the same year as Tomb Raider or thereabouts -- and this game is not as good as that game. I *STRONGLY* suggest you instead have a much better experience with this game by going to youtube and watching a "Let's Play" -- you will NOT have to struggle with the horrible interface and you will get amusing commentary about the frustrating elements instead of the frustrating elements themselves."

reviewText: Classic Dungeon exploration at its finest, had to get it again once i seen it on steam, played this game years ago on PS1 & was hooked,  great exploration elements & combat, even if the controls were slightly limited, they took some time to get used too, but that was one of the main charms of this great game, every area you explore, every level you enter, nothing is as it seems, just when you thought you were over the worst, BAM, there would be another ambush of enemies or another insane trap to deal with, were you would usually die multiple times before you could figure out a sensible approach to each environment, not that this is a bad thing, users really have to be aware of there surroundings in this game or you'll be heavily punished... All these elements are what make this game a classic, Now to figure out how to use the controls again...lol...!
voteText: 7 of 14 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Gaming should be fun, gaming should be original. This title might not be all of these, but it was the game that started it all for me. I saw this game in a box with eidos surrounding it. A white border box with the name eidos. Anyway, gaming has died. I post this review here because games aren't about games anymore. Uh, how can I explain.. Games used to be fun, original, classic. They had old game engines, hard mechanics and you didn't know where to go. See, everything went downhill. We have graphics that are still poor somehow. We have to upgrade our pcs each year or so if a super game comes out. Uhm games aren't fun anymore. There's games like sims 2, deathtrap dungeon, final fantasy (the old ones), bloodrayne 1, giants citizen kabuto. They were classic. They weren't limited to go there kill that. Yea, they kinda were. However, the way you did that was very original. You laughed one moment and then you used a jetpack to kill some monsters with special weapons. The artstyle too, it's way too boring in games these days. Colorful graphics, simple yet memorable textures and music that always stood in your memory. Why can't we have that these days? Do we really have to become kids again? I know I talk so much and I shouldn't type that much in this review but I want to end this review streak with something. Gaming used to be simple. Gaming used to be interesting and less money based. HELL GAMES LIKE HALO AND ONI WERE INCREDIBLE. You haven't heard of oni? Well it's a bloody game that bungie made and rockstar published. You were an anime girl who had tons of fighting moves and you could shoot guns. You were fighting the mafia. What the hell do we have these days? A stupid guy with a cloak who kills random guard. My oh my, and a super story going on around him. You see it's things like these that make me rage.. uh maybe i don't like change. However, I want my games back. There was a spiderman game where you took out a bomb out of a building or where you were fighting symbiotes on top of a moving train, or where you were saving mary jane from venom. What do we have these days? Nothing. Sorry for the incoherence but I'm trying to find out what happened and why games these days are so bad. I don't think I can find the exact reason, but I think the people were smarter. They were also nicer, kinda. But that's my opinion. Crimson skies is another game I remember from my childhood. Together with freelancer, or urban chaos. God bless those who made great videogames. Because, they will always be remembered. Revy's speech out. :)

reviewText: This is a pale imitation of the PS1 version.   While both versions have crap controls and camera, at least on the PS1 it was still pretty fun and there is something captivating about the game, having to force yourself through a dungeon filled with traps and monsters in order to survive and escape.  But the PC version is just horrible.  I just got a new monitor and because the resolution for DD is 800x600 max, this means I can't even play it now cos it 'fails to render' when I start.  But even before, when I could play it on my old monitor, the game is terrible.  The levels are mixed up and all wrong, and they've stupidly tried to give the blood and gore an update so the more you get injured its reflected on the character.  I can't stress enough how bad it looks, its just outright terrible.  The outdated graphics of the PS1 version look better.  Save your money.  Do not buy this game.  Get a PS1 and play that version of Deathtrap Dungeon instead, you'll have a much better time.
